content:
I think the discussion helped solidify my thoughts and feelings about the novel. It was interesting to hear how others interpreted certain scenes or characters, but ultimately, it reaffirmed my own feelings about the book.

As for the ending, I think most of us agreed that it was emotional and thought-provoking. Some members felt it was a bit rushed, while others appreciated how it wrapped up the storylines. I personally thought it was a fitting conclusion to the novel, given the themes and tone of the book. We also talked about how the ending made us think about the characters' futures and the impact of their experiences on their lives.

By the way, I've been meaning to ask: do you have any recommendations for books that explore the theme of women's roles in wartime? I've been interested in reading more about this topic, and I thought you might have some suggestions.
